decks.notes: The deck revolves around using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the library, while protecting the combo with Force of Will and other control spells. The win condition is to put Thassa's Oracle on top of the library with Narcomoeba and then draw a card to win the game. The deck also includes support cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for consistency, as well as disruption spells like Swords to Plowshares and Teferi, Time Raveler to interact with the opponent. The main goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to secure the win.

The deck focuses on generating mana and controlling the board using cards like Gaea's Cradle, Green Sun's Zenith, and Natural Order to ramp up and put threats into play. It utilizes creatures like Atraxa and Wight of the Reliquary to apply pressure while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Thoughtseize and Collector Ouphe. The deck aims to establish a strong presence on the battlefield while hindering the opponent's game plan, ultimately out-valuing them and securing a win through efficient resource management and strategic plays.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and control elements, such as counter spells and bounce effects. The deck focuses on generating value through creatures like Gilded Drake and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, while also utilizing planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to provide additional value and card advantage. The mana base is built to support the deck's aggressive strategy while also offering some protection and utility with lands like Karakas and Homeward Path.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. It utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, along with disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition. The deck also includes a strong removal package with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Solitude. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad allows for extra value with flickering creatures for further disruption. The deck aims to control the board and win through incremental advantage and efficient creature beats.
